noun.description: The front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach and bowels.

examples: as she leaned forward her sweater bellied out
the wind bellied the sail out

verb.description: Move or sit close to (a bar or table)
examples: regulars who first bellied up to the bar years before

phrases: The worst that can happen is that your company goes belly up, and this is particularly pertinent when it comes to with-profits investments.
If the company goes belly up, the share will be worthless forever.
Actually, he thinks that if his career ever went belly up, he'd open an American-style diner somewhere between Glasgow and Oban.
Origami Bank has folded, Sumo Bank has gone belly up and Bonsai Bank plans to cut back some of its branches.
But if a company rep sells something which subsequently goes belly up, then the company itself is liable.
origin: Old English belig bag, of Germanic origin, from a base meaning swell, be inflated.
